title: How to Bake a Strawberry Pie

steps.headline: Layer about 3/4 of the strawberries (432g) on the pie crust.
Mash the rest 1/4 of the strawberries (144g) with the sugar, cornstarch, and water in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium heat.
steps.description: Stir constantly to avoid the mixture from burning.

steps.headline: Boil the mixture for 2 to 3 minutes.
steps.description: Remove from heat and set on the side to cool.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture over the strawberries and pie crust.
Place in the refrigerator for several hours to overnight.
Use a hand or stand mixer to whip the heavy cream.
steps.description: Wait for soft peaks to form.

steps.headline: Serve the strawberry pie with a topping of whipped cream.

text: Layer about 3/4 of the strawberries (432g) on the pie crust.  Mash the rest 1/4 of the strawberries (144g) with the sugar, cornstarch, and water in a medium saucepan.  Bring to a boil over medium heat. Stir constantly to avoid the mixture from burning. Boil the mixture for 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat and set on the side to cool. Pour the mixture over the strawberries and pie crust.  Place in the refrigerator for several hours to overnight.  Use a hand or stand mixer to whip the heavy cream. Wait for soft peaks to form. Serve the strawberry pie with a topping of whipped cream.
